WorkPlace.Name: Semco Maritime
WorkPlace.OrganizationDescription: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.

HiringOrg.Name: Semco Maritime
HiringOrg.OrganizationDescription: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Are you looking for the perfect opportunity to develop your career in the field of project engineering? Would you like to be the part of the execution of tender and engineering projects within offshore firefighting?
Then you are the one for us!

Your position
In our Products and Technology team, you will join our dedicated and highly skilled Firefighting team of 16 specialists. The team is responsible for everything from creating the tenders to project completion. Our projects range from DKK 0.5 million to DKK 35 million and cover everything from inert gas suppression systems to self-contained foam systems.

This position will give you a great opportunity to further your career in the project engineering aspects of Firefighting systems. You will be a part of a passionate team of Project Managers, Engineers, Documents Controllers and Service Engineers who are all determined to deliver the best result to the customer in an ever changing environment.

Your tasks & responsibilities
As a Project Engineer in our P&T Division working in our firefighting team you will be involved in all parts of our engineering projects. Therefore, your responsibilities will be related to taking part in the different project phases with a high degree of collaboration with your team.

Your tasks will include but are not limited to:
  • Ensuring the project progresses in adherence to schedules, budgets, fulfilment, contractual obligations and realizations
  • Being responsible for engineering and documentation while also providing assistance/advice to the site/installation supervision and commissioning activities as needed
  • Working with the procurement team to ensure that approved project purchases adhere to costs while still ensuring quality and compatibility
  • Finding and documenting the right technical solutions while engaging with our technical teams, HSEQ, Procurement and other relevant departments
  • Preparing potential project risk analyses and working to increase profit margins of projects
Your profile & qualifications
The most important thing in the right candidate is that you are a passionate about what you do, and that you take pride in what you are a part of creating.
You should actively want to participate in teamwork and be proactive in your approach to your work. Naturally, we are looking for someone who is also motivated by working in a dedicated project team with a high degree of commitment.

To succeed in this position, we expect that you have the following qualifications:
  • Degree in mechanical engineering, marine engineering or similar
  • Broad range of technical skills and knowledge of firefighting systems is preferred
  • Great communication skills in English and Danish, verbal and written
  • Experience with project engineering from a similar position
Welcome to Semco Maritime
We offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international organization, where we strive to provide innovative and sustainable solutions. You will get the unique opportunity to work in an environment characterized by dedication, passion and ambition.

You will be working from our headquarters in Esbjerg by the seafront, we offer one of the best views in the city!

We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page.
If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Martin Uhrskov Christensen at +45 30 16 67 01.

We look forward to hearing from you!
